data.title: Israel (Gershowitz) Gershwin (1896-1983)

data.text:
[spouse(s) unknown]

[children unknown]

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 4 Jul 2024 | Created 19 Aug 2014

This page has been accessed 1,809 times.

Biography

Ira (Gershowitz) Gershwin has Jewish Roots.

Ira (Gershowitz) Gershwin is Notable.

American lyricist who collaborated with his younger brother, composer George Gershwin, to create some of the most memorable songs of the 20th century.

Gershwin was born Israel Gershowitz in New York City to Morris (Moishe) and Rose Gershovitz who changed the family name to Gershvin well before their children rose to fame. In the 1900 census Isidore Grsheven (age 3) was the son of Morris Grsheven in Brooklyn Ward 22, Kings, New York.[1] In the 1910 census Isidor Gershvem (age 13) was the son of Morris Gershvem in Manhattan Ward 10, New York, New York, United States.[2]

He married Leonore (née Strunsky) in 1926.

Ira Gershwin, son of Bruskin, died (age 86) on 17 August 1983 in Los Angeles, California, United States.[3] He is interred at Westchester Hills Cemetery, Hastings-on-Hudson, New York.[4]
